item.description:
I know that most of you are very interested in getting out on the water and getting up-close to boats. So rather than an official meetup for June, I want to let you know about a free sailing event and a chance to see world-class racers first hand.

Over Memorial Day weekend, Boston Sailing Center will offer free sailing trips around Boston Harbor. No experience is necessary and all ages are welcome. The Center is located on a converted Louisiana riverboat docked at Lewis Wharf, a short walk from Faneuil Hall Marketplace and the Aquarium T station (Blue Line). For details, visit: http://www.bostonsail.... Of course (caution, shameless plug ahead), if you want to take sailing lessons or get a sailing membership, I suggest SailTime Boston and sister-school Black Rock Sailing School.

The Transat, a single-handed race across the Atlantic from Plymouth England to Boston, is scheduled to finish in Boston on Friday night. The boats will be docked at Rowes Wharf over the weekend. I imagine that you will be able to get very close to the boats, and some may even be open for boarding and skippers may eb on-hand. This is a rare chance to see an Open 60 up-close; I wouldn't pass it up.

No RSVPs necessary. Enjoy!
item.name: The Boston Sailing June Meeting
